item.description:
typo in /wp-admin/profile.php line 78 is:

$newuser_url = wp_specialchars($_POST['newuser_url')];

and should be:

$newuser_url = wp_specialchars($_POSTnewuser_url?);

item.title: Ticket #398 (Cookie problem with wikka) updated
item.dc:creator: AndreaRossato
item.description:
No, it is not related to bug 60. The problem is due to the fact that cookies, when register globals is set to On are just normal global variables. I still have to find out where the query gets the $post_name, but when a cookie with "name" ad its name is set in the domain it will be used by wordpress to perform the query.

To reproduce create in the wordpress directory a file with just these lines: <?php SetCookie("name", "prova", 0, "/"); ?> load it and then load wordpress. If register_globals is set to On you'll get: "Sorry, no posts matched your criteria."

item.title: Ticket #398 (Cookie problem with wikka) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description:
Is this related to bug 60, which has been resolved?

â€‹http://mosquito.wordpress.org/view.php?id=60

item.title: Ticket #398 (Cookie problem with wikka) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
The problem comes from register_globals php.ini directive: if set to On the cookie name will be used in the wp_query object to perform the query. The have a confirmation add print_r($GLOBALS); in wp-header.php

That affects 1.3 too.

item.title: Ticket #541 (is_date() returns TRUE for permalinks) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #541 (is_date() returns TRUE for permalinks) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description:
is_date(), at least according to Ryan's into to is_*() functions, should return true on year, month, or day pages. It currently returns true on permalink pages (is_single() pages).

Right now I'm getting around that with this, at the top of date.php

< ?php if(is_single()) { include 'index.php'; exit(); } ? >

One instance of $entrypost_title? actually reads $entrypost_itle?

I haven't bothered analysis the impact of this fault, but patch attached.

item.title: Ticket #539 (1.3-alpha-5 get_[year|month|day]_link functions produce broken links ...) updated
item.dc:creator: funkknight
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #539 (1.3-alpha-5 get_[year|month|day]_link functions produce broken links ...) created
item.dc:creator: funkknight
item.description:
Archive and Calendar links are generated as: â€‹http://website.org2004/12/12/ (missing slash between dns and path)

To get it working I changed the following line in the get_[year|month|day]_link functions in the file "wp-includes/templates-functions-links.php":

return get_settings('home') trailingslashit($monthlink); to return get_settings('home') .'/'. trailingslashit($monthlink);

Permalink structure of: /entry/%posttitle%

item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When I tried to access my WordPress 1.2.1 blog using SharpReader v0.9.5.1, the latter would report "Error reading URL: The underlying connection was closed: The server committed an HTTP protocol violation." and would fail to list any of the blog items.

item.title: Ticket #405 (Trackback title format bungs up HTML entities) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description:
This fixes it... although it's a bandaid solution:

function clean_amp_chars($text){ $search = "/&([a-zA-Z0-9#]{3,10});/i"; $replace = "&$1;"; $text = preg_replace($search, $replace, $text); return $text; } add_filter('comment_author', 'clean_amp_chars', 100); add_filter('comment_text', 'clean_amp_chars', 100);

item.title: Ticket #405 (Trackback title format bungs up HTML entities) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Owner, Priority, Status, Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #405 (Trackback title format bungs up HTML entities) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: The same happens for PingBack titles. I've been trying to create a regex that would fix this... we need to look for & followed by X chars and ";"

item.title: Ticket #536 (Quicktags cause jump to top of post in firefox.) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #536 (Quicktags cause jump to top of post in firefox.) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: In firefox, but in no other browser, when one uses a quicktag, wordpress will automaticly scroll up to the top of ones post. This is extremley annoying, allthough not big enough to stop ones use. It has been reproduced in safari 1.0 on two different computers, with different blogs. It does not happen in IE or safari, though opera has not been tested.
